snippet: In his first speech in Sri Lanka, Pope Francis said leaders of major religions have a role to play in healing the wounds from the civil conflict that ended in 2009.
abstract: Pope Francis visits Sri Lanka, saying in speech that religious leaders should help in process of reconciliation after civil war.

byline.original: By DHARISHA BASTIANS and GARDINER HARRIS
byline.contributor: Dharisha Bastians reported from Colombo, and Gardiner Harris from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: In his first speech in Sri Lanka, Pope Francis said leaders of major religions have a role to play in healing the wounds from the civil conflict that ended in 2009.

headline.main: Pope Says Sri Lanka Must Confront Truth About Its War to Heal
headline.print_headline: Pope Says Sri Lanka Must Confront Truth About Its War to Heal
